PSC591.name: Special Problems in Psychiatry
PSC591.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC591.description: Work under the direction of a faculty member on an experimental, theoretical, or applied problem.

PSC602.name: Primary Care Ambulatory Clerkship
PSC602.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC602.description: A 24-week ambulatory care continuity experience involving 12 weeks in a multidisciplinary environment (family medicine, pediatrics, and internal medicine), 4 weeks in family medicine and 8 weeks in specialty areas (internal medicine, surgery, pediatrics, and obstetrics and gynecology). Didactic sessions are scheduled concurrently.

PSC603.name: Core Clinical Concepts
PSC603.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC603.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

PSC608.name: Psychiatry and Behavioral Science Clerkship
PSC608.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC608.description: Supervised practice with in-patient, out-patient, emergency, and community mental health services.
PSC608.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or in the College of Human Medicine.

PSC609.name: Adult Psychiatry Clerkship
PSC609.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC609.description: Experience in psychiatry in clinical settings with adults.
PSC609.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or in the College of Human Medicine.

PSC610.name: Child Psychiatry Clerkship
PSC610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC610.description: Experience in psychiatry in clinical settings with child patients and their families.
PSC610.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine or in the College of Human Medicine.

PSC611.name: Addiction Psychiatry Clerkship
PSC611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC611.description: Knowledge and skills in psychopathology, psychiatric diagnosis, psychiatric therapies and prevention with addiction patients and their families.
PSC611.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine or in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

PSC612.name: Geriatric Psychiatry Clerkship
PSC612.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC612.description: Knowledge and skills in psychopathology, psychiatric diagnosis, psychiatric therapies and prevention of psychiatric illness with geriatric patients and their families.
PSC612.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine or in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

PSC633.name: Extended Clinical Experience
PSC633.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC633.description: Based in community hospitals and ambulatory sites, this is a 4 week clinical experience emphasizing interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy.

PSC641.name: Psychiatry and Behavioral Science Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience
PSC641.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC641.description: Supervised practice with in-patient, out-patient, emergency, and community mental health services.
PSC641.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PSC644.name: Psychiatry and Behavioral Science Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience Remediation
PSC644.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PSC644.description: Interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy based in community hospitals and/or ambulatory sites.
PSC644.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.
